page.title: 09Bronze Age in West Ashby.
page.content: In 1977 archaeologists found a bronze age burial ground near the gravelpits. A team of enthusiasts was led by Miss Naomi Field of the North Lincs Arch- aeological Unit.During the summer they found remains of a cremation and an almost intact pot.The cremation pit was oval in shape and measured 80cm x 60cm x 20cm deep and was filled with charcoal, heat shattered flint and some cremated bone.The pit lay one field noth of an early bronze age barrow,half of which had been quarried away.There were three ditches visable and a collared urn was found which contained cremated bone, two flint arrow heads and a bronze razor.Both sites were found with the aid of aerial photography.
